div.p: This value set expansion contains 7 concepts.

tr.td: http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D2.DT.Inputs
Hepatitis B birth dose was not administered
Count of vaccines administered (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines" and "Birth dose" = TRUE) = 0
http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D2.DT.Inputs
Client's age is less than {Member States defined upper limit}
Today's date − "Date of birth" < Member States defined upper limit
http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D2.DT.Inputs
Client's age is more than {Member States defined upper limit}
Today's date - "Date of birth" > Member States defined upper limit
http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D2.DT.Inputs
Hepatitis B birth dose was administered
Count of vaccines administered (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines" and "Birth dose" = TRUE) = 1
http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D2.DT.Outputs
Client is due for hepatitis B monovalent vaccine
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" (where "Type of hepatitis B dose" = "Hepatitis B monovalent vaccine")
http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D2.DT.Outputs
Client should follow delayed-start decision logic
http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D2.DT.Outputs
Client is not due for the hepatitis B birth dose
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

description.value: ValueSet IMMZ.D2.DT.HepatitisB.Birth for IMMZ.D2.DT.Hepatitis B.Birth dose. Business rule: Determine if the client is due for a hepatitis B vaccination according to the national immunization schedule Trigger: IMMZ.D2 Determine required vaccination(s) if any Table: Birth dose administration
